File libsrc/libcssio/s3s4.c

s3tos4 (void *, register int)

Public Functions

s3tos4 
 void s3tos4(void *byte,
             register int n)
Decompress s3 data.

NOTE - to use this routine, it is assumed byte is allocated long enough and has the correct alignment

This routine copies the 2 lsb of the 3-byte to the 2 lsb of the 4-byte, Then can just copy the last byte into what correctly-aligned short. Also, unroll and use direct addressing since it is more efficient.

Parameters:
byte - A 4-byte aligned buffer of length at least 4 * n bytes.
n - The number of values to be converted in place.
s4tos3 
 void s4tos3(void *byte,
             register int n)
Compress to s3 data.

NOTE - to use this routine, it is assumed that no value in the original 4-byte array exceeds 3 significant bytes of data.

The routine copies 3 lsb of the 4-byte to the 3-byte. Also, unroll and use direct addressing since it is more efficient.

Parameters:
byte - A 4-byte aligned buffer of length at least 4 * n bytes.
n - The number of values to be converted in place.
